meanings.definition: Bind (someone) by an indenture as an apprentice or laborer.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith was indenturing the young boy to learn the trade.
meanings.sent2: She was indenturing new employees to work in the factory.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked that he was indenturing his rabbit as his apprentice.
meanings.sent4: The mentor was indenturing wisdom into the eager minds of the students.
meanings.sent5: The captain was indenturing discipline in the crew to ensure smooth sailing.

meanings.definition: The action of binding someone by an indenture as an apprentice or laborer.
meanings.sent1: Indenturing was a common practice in the colonial era.
meanings.sent2: The indenturing of young workers helped meet the demand for labor.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit portrayed indenturing in a humorous light.
meanings.sent4: The concept of indenturing was like a contract with a twist.
meanings.sent5: The history lesson made the process of indenturing clear to the students.
